channel.title: Can you make your own domain?
channel.description:
What I wanted to learn or know was is there a way to make your own like .com or .org site and host it yourself without having to pay?
Can somone post a site that like teaches you how? because it doesn't seem as simple as typing it all in one post.

item.title: Can you make your own domain?
item.dc:creator: @vraj82192 vraj82192
item.description:
@vraj82192 wrote:

Well how do you get points? I can’t figure out how to get points.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you make your own domain?

item.title: Can you make your own domain?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“vraj82192, post:4, topic:148877”]Great thanks

But it does actually work right? Lol
And I was looking for a manuall way to make one, but this works too

Edit:

EEK! [quote] You can complete our entire program and be qualified for your domain typically in under twenty minutes![/quote][/quote]
Yeah, I got threaljdb.org from there, and I’m going to use a sister site to pay the re-register fee.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you make your own domain?

item.title: Can you make your own domain?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The “manual way to make one” is to become an accredited registrar. You can look up the details on ICANN, but the short answer is no, you cannot do it. You need a hundred thousand dollars or so capital, and even then you have to pay ICANN fees.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you make your own domain?

Edit:

EEK!

You can complete our entire program and be qualified for your domain typically in under twenty minutes!
